summary: This is a letter from Smith Viltozor LLP to Judge Alison J. Nathan regarding the case United States v. Maxwell. The letter, written on behalf of the independent administrator of the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program (EVCP), informs the court of a second production of documents responsive to Ghislaine Maxwell's subpoena, delivered via a secure FTP site. It details redaction practices applied to protect claimant identities.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The presiding judge in the Southern District of New York to whom the letter is addressed regarding the document production in the case against Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Maxwell
persons.context: Referred to as the defendant in the case 'United States v. Maxwell' and the issuer of the subpoena to which the document production is a response.

connections.description: Judge Nathan is the presiding judicial officer over the criminal case in which Maxwell is the defendant.

events.title: Court's memo-endorsement of letter
events.description: The court endorsed a prior letter from Smith Viltozor LLP, authorizing or acknowledging the process for document production related to Maxwell's subpoena.

events.title: Second document production to the court
events.description: Smith Viltozor LLP, on behalf of the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program administrator, makes a second production of documents responsive to Maxwell's subpoena to Judge Nathan's court.

locations: 40 Foley Square, New York, New York 10007
250 West 55th Street, 30th Floor, New York, NY 10019
keyFacts: The Epstein Victims' Compensation Program (EVCP) is producing documents in response to a subpoena from Ghislaine Maxwell.
Redactions were applied to protect the identities of four specific individuals named in the subpoena and other EVCP claimants, in accordance with Federal Rule of Criminal Procedure 49.1(a).
Documents were delivered to the court via a secure FTP site, indicating the sensitive nature of the material.
The letter confirms an ongoing legal process where the EVCP is compelled to provide materials for Maxwell's defense.
Some redactions in the produced materials were pre-existing from when the documents were originally provided to the EVCP.
